content.text: A customer buys 9 metres of this fabric
Calculate the change he receives from \$50
The selling price of \$2.97 per metre is an increase of 8% on the cost price
Calculate the cost price
$- .........per metre $
A shop sells dress fabric for \$2.97 per metre
A dressmaker charges \$35 or 2300 rupees to make a dress
Calculate the difference in price when the exchange rate is \(\) 1\(rupee =\) \ \(0.0153\)
Give your answer in rupees
.........rupees
The dressmaker measures a length of fabric as \(600\mathrm{m}\) , correct to the nearest 5 metres
He cuts this into dress lengths of \(9\mathrm{m}\) , correct to the nearest metre
Calculate the largest number of complete dress lengths he could cut
Calculate the area of the square
Calculate the area of the shaded segment
Calculate the perimeter of the shaded segment

On the grid, draw the graph of \(\begin{array}{r}y = 2x + \frac{1}{x} - 3 \end{array}\) for \(\begin{array}{r}0.125\leqslant x\leqslant 3. \end{array}\)
Use your graph to solve \(\quad 2x + \frac{1}{x} - 3 \geqslant 2.\)
Write down the equation of this straight line
Draw this straight line and solve the equation \(\frac{1}{x} = 7 - 3x.\)
The equation \(\frac{1}{x} = 7 - 3x\) can be solved using your graph in part (b) and a straight line

more gold balloons than silver balloons

The frequency table shows information about the time, \(m\) minutes, that each of 160 people spend in a library
